summary: HAdV types are characterized in children in the area with acute lower respiratory tract infections (ALRTIs) the clinical features and laboratory findings of hospitalized HAdV-infected cases are described. a total of 11 different types of HAdV were detected throughout the study period. HAdV-B7 infection tends to have more severe clinical consequences. the presence of newly emerging types or variants highlights the need for constant and close surveillance of HAdV infection.
